title: Workshop on Developing Mathematical Peer Observation Criteria for Online Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in high-level project execution, along with foundational understanding of basic statistics and matrix operations
context.additional_context: In a math-subject-integrated PBL environment for training professionals in medical, legal, and technical fields, the focus is on building observation systems through data-driven decision-making and mathematical modeling.

learning_goals: The Process of Developing Online Peer Observation Criteria Using the e-Delphi Technique Can Be Explained Through Mathematical Modeling
Thirteen Key Observation Categories (e.g., Interaction Design, Assessment Systems) Applicable to Online Learning Environments Can Be Analyzed Using Mathematical Statistical Techniques
A Team Feedback Model Can Be Developed Using Mathematical Algorithms (Matrix/Graph Theory) Based on 81 Detailed Observation Items
A Systematic Method for Analyzing Peer Observation Data Using Digital Devices (Applying Probability/Statistics) Is Applied
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
